experience: You and Matt both know Tim Mortimer, Stephen "Oz" Oslund, and 30 others

Multi Media Specialist – Director of Photography, Producer, Director, Videographer, EditorThe Multi Media Specialist coordinates all aspects of video production with an emphasis on delivering quality products that communicate key messaging.  This is accomplished by recording, editing, encoding and delivering high quality communications materials.  The Multi Media Specialist uses Sony XDCAM EX high definition cameras and nonlinear editing systems to achieve these goals.  As Director of Photography/Director the Multi Media Specialist is proficient in EFP, lighting, audio and live production in the studio and on remote.  ¥	Writes, produces, directs, shoots and edits video productions.¥	Coordinates production elements including script, scene progression, action sequences, dialogue, narration, lighting, music, releases, and settings.¥	Coordinates scheduling of productions, including talent, equipment and technical crew and other effects as needed.¥	Supervises postproduction work including editing, sound recording, dubbing and mixing and other special effects.¥	Sets up and manages audio and video equipment, including lighting, microphones, computers, cabling and other equipment¥	Provides assistance in script development from an initial concept through the research stage and finally production.¥	Serves as director of photography and editor of client sponsored productions. Provides quality computer graphic design work for all productions created.Maintains audio/visual library of original footage, B-roll, interviews, stock footage, news coverage, etc.; orders necessary supplies and equipment.Troubleshoots and maintains production equipment; research, analyzes and recommends new methods/equipment to enhance multimedia department operations and efficiency.Proficiently operates professional level audiovisual equipment; estimates time, cost, personnel and equipment requirements for audiovisual production; plans, organizes and supervises production.

Teaching VPT 108 Video Production in the Department of Art and Photography Digital Media Arts. Video production technology corporate, cable, and broadcast applications. Basic production techniques in scriptwriting; single camera film style shooting; lighting, audio recording; and editing; post-production techniques, production personnel and their roles, budgeting and copyright issues.  Also teaching VPT 105 Studio Production: Multiple camera studio production for corporate, film, cable, and broadcast applications. Basic single and multi-camera production techniques, talent and camera blocking, set design, scriptwriting; shooting; lighting, audio and video recording; production crew team member experience, pre-production planning and budgeting and decision-making.
Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication

Teaching 2 sections of JMC 120 Studio Production in the Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication at Arizona State University in downtown Phoenix, Arizona.  The students will produce short newscasts and perform the duties of director, technical director, graphics operator, video playback, prompter, audio, camera and floor director.  Course goals and objectives:1)     Develop familiarity with the studio equipment, its care and operation, andbasic production procedures. 2)	Introduce the vocabulary of production.3)	Teach the importance of cooperation and collaboration, and develop the ability to function as a member of a production team.4)	Develop sound attitudes towards assignments and constructive criticism.5)	Develop an appreciation of production as a tool  of the communicationprocess.6)	Discuss career opportunities in the diverse market place.

Photography, lighting and sometimes audio for national clients; ABC Sports, NBC Sports, CBS, FOX, ESPN, A&E, EXTRA, INSIDE EDITION, AMERICAN JOURNAL, Discovery Channel, Safeco Insurance, US West, Charles Schwab, Salt River Project, Platinum TV, Michael Hoff Productions,  Merck Pharmaceutical
Replay/tape op, Director and technical director for Arizona Coyotes and other events at Gila River Arena.
